column1: Q1. By continuing, you accept to the terms of the privacy policy and data protection above.
Q2. Which of the following statements describe your role? Please check all that apply.

A researcher who is within a quantum computing provider, research lab, academic institution or start-up focused on using a variety of techniques to build quantum technology (e.g. optimizers, algorithms, or hardware).
A software developer who is within an organization, responsible for designing, developing, and testing software.
An educator who is working to develop the next generation of quantum professionals.
A hobbyist who is interested in quantum computing but has no work or academic responsibilities tied to it.
A student in the quantum field or otherwise.
A business leader who is interested in safeguarding company vision, making new product discoveries and/or tackling high impact problems that are not easily solvable with classical computing.
A program manager who is responsible for identifying opportunities for quantum in their organization and creating teams to explore quantum.
Q3. Which of the following statements best describe your background?
I have a background in quantum research
I have a background in classical programming and software technologies
I have a background in non-quantum research (I’m a researcher but not in quantum)
I have a background in quantum programming and software technologies
Q4. Which of the following statements best describe your main reason for your involvement in quantum technologies?
My goal is to use quantum technologies to experiment and advance quantum science and knowledge
My goal is to understand what quantum technologies are capable of and prepare for use of quantum technologies
My goal is to learn something new and interesting
Q5. Which of the following options represent the type of organization(s) you are affiliated with? Please check all that apply.
Q6. Approximately how many people are employed by the organization you are currently affiliated with?
Just me - I am a freelancer, sole proprietor, independent, etc.
Q7. Do you get paid for working with Quantum Technology?
Yes, but as a side project
Q8. If yes, on average, how long did you stay with previous employers before changing companies?
I don’t know, I never changed companies

I don't work in quantum tech

Q16. Have you ever used any Quantum Software?Quantum Software is any tool that assists with connecting to quantum computing cloud services or research in the fields of quantum computing or quantum physics, as well as study, teach, learn, develop, simulate, or interact with quantum computing concepts.
Q17. When it comes to the Quantum Software project you are most involved in, what best describes your role during the last year?
I did not use any quantum software in the last year
User: I installed or used the software.
Contributor: I submitted an issue or a Pull Request (PR).
Maintainer: I am in charge of reviewing PRs, triaging issues, or/and maintaining documentation.
Project Owner: I contribute to defining the project strategy and roadmap.

Q25. Please select the type of quantum computing research you are performing. Please check all that apply.
Application development (development of software packages or adaption of algorithms for specific usecases/industries)
Algorithm development (developmentcmathematics and algorithms. This includes QML and optimization)
Circuit development & optimization (how to best implement an algorithm on the quantum computer)
Software Engineering (such as the development, test and verification, of software used to operate a quantum computer)
Q26. Please select the area of quantum computing you believe to be the most promising for future research.Please check all that apply.
Application development (development of software packages or adaption of algorithms for specific usecases/industries)
Algorithm development (developmentcmathematics and algorithms. This includes QML and optimization)
Circuit development & optimization (how to best implement an algorithm on the quantum computer)
Software Engineering (such as the development, test and verification, of software used to operate a quantum computer)

Q32. How welcoming do you feel the quantum software community is? The quantum software community includes the people and structures, both online and off-line, of professionals, students and volunteers involved in developing software projects for quantum science and quantum technology.
Q33. In your opinion, what is the impact of open source software on the quantum software community?
Q34. When it comes to developing quantum software, where do you go for answers or information?
Project repository (GitHub, GitLab) or code base
Other Project Forum (eg. Discourse, Google forum)
Q35. Which of the following types of resources/ engagements do you find helpful for your learning or contributing to quantum open source projects? Please select all that apply.
Hackathons (eg. QHack, Qiskit Camps, Big Quantum Hackathon by Quant X , unitaryHACK, …)
Mentorship programs (eg. QOSF mentorships, Unitary Fund Microgrants, Qiskit Advocate Mentorship Program, individual/private mentoring …)
Certificate or degrees (eg. IBM Qiskit Developer Certificate, MITx Quantum, QWorld Certificate, …)
Participative courses (Courses, in person or remote, where you have to actively participate. eg. Qiskit Global Summer School, Qubit x Qubit Introduction Course)
Digital education text resources (eg. Qiskit Textbook, OSS Project tutorials and documentation, etc.)
Video resources (eg. YouTube explanations, QWorld talks, Qiskit seminars, QHack videos, etc.)
